review_text: I visited here and was so so so annoyed.  First, I actually made an appointment on Friday but I received a letter that says that my appointment is on Tuesday at 10am. My wife called (because I cannot speak French) to ask why and they told us " ah~ this is just to register me on the system so I should give them some papers " and " if you don't come on Tuesday, the appointment on Friday will be cancelled " so wait again? Anyway I had things to do but I thought it would be ok. Because it is only to submit the papers.  I went there 15 minutes earlier because it would be better finishing as soon as possible. I told people I had an appointment today at 10am. They asked me to wait on the seat. I tried to do things I had to do on my phone but internet connection wasn't so good that I couldn't do it. At 10:15, I asked them again how long I should wait? Because no one came to me first. I was told to wait again. At 10:32, one woman(counselor : I should have asked her name) said sorry for wait blah blah blah(she coundn't speak English)  I followed her into her office. I put out all the papers I took, and show her. She could see all the papers but she kept saying something in French. I said I don't speak French. She didn't stop saying the word and didn't bother to say it slowly. I thought it was something else. She could see all my documents but she was just waiting until I gave her. She didn't even bother to check the documents I put out. In the end, she said passport in English. I gave her and I asked her why it was late. I called wife to translate her sayings.  I don't think her reason was true. She said it was technical problem. But there were computers and internet was working. Some staff at the Accueil were working with computer as well. review_text: As many public services in France, PE lacks technology, objectivity and efficiency. Personnel are kind, but unable to sort out issues. Their operation is hindered by a legacy of inefficiency, visible at PE website and systems which are often unavailable ("pardon, mon systeme mouline, mouline, et finalement √ßa bug, madame"). After 3 months of online inscription, many complaints and 3 physical visits to PE I started receiving my rights. 3 months. Imagine if I had a family to support. I am dissatisfied with the complexity of processes, the slow speed of service, and the effort required to navigate through processes. Citizens want processes to be simpler, faster, and easier to use, in line with the way we do everything else (learning, shopping, traveling, etc). As long as you cultivate this culture of indifference to the zeitgeist and citizens needs, French government will always be dealing with protests on the streets.
